page.title: 14Sparham Industry (2)
page.content: The Old Rectory is now a family home and also the administration and distr- ibution headquarters of 'Mainstone's Publications' a firm of Art publishers whose prints are produced in Thetford. Another printer produces a Radio Ham magazine. "Changes" is a 'nearly-new' clothes and bric-a-brac business newly opened in her home by a young mother. At Manor Farm are the offices for Bawdeswell Farms, a dairy enterprise in the next village. An agricultural contractor undertakes cultivation work for local farmers. Until recently the Swan Rescue Service was run by Mr & Mrs Len Baker in Sparham. Swans injured by gun-shot, poisoned by lead fishing-weights, or damaged by entanglement in fishing lines, were brought here to be treated. Concern about overhead power- lines has forced the sanctuary to move
